message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

Reasoning: 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely category as the paper deals with language modeling and rewriting text in a specific author's style. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also likely as the paper proposes a novel approach to leverage the generalization capabilities of a language model for generating stylized text. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning) is relevant as the paper uses a denoising autoencoder (DAE) loss in a cascaded encoder-decoder framework to fine-tune the language model. 
- cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is relevant as the paper uses Transformer-based neural models for language modeling. 
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is relevant as the paper proposes a linguistically-motivated framework to evaluate the efficacy of the approach in terms of stylistic alignment at lexical, syntactic and surface levels.
